com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Trace

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.Trace

public class Trace
extends com.conceptwave.scripting.Object

CwfScriptTraceLog enables the Application developer to add tracing in the application flows. There will be only one instance of this class in each AVM, and the instance is instantiated by CwpProcessManager. The class is also exposed as a JMXBean, and it allows the trace configuration to be modified through the JMX api.

Method Detail

getCurrentTraceID

public static String getCurrentTraceID()
Get the trace ID for current context. trace Id is null if the tracing in not enabled.

Returns:

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isTraceEnabled()
Is the trace enabled for current context

Returns:

setTraceContext

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean setTraceContext(String traceID,
                                                                String traceInterface,
                                                                String[] filters)
This method will set the trace context. The tracing will be enabled if either of the two conditions is true
  • traceID is not empty. In this case traceInterface and filters are not used
  • traceID is empty, and a trace job matching the interface and the filters, exists in AVM

    A matching job is where
  • the interface name for the job is same as traceInterface,
  • and traceJob.startTime <= current time and tracejob.endTime >= currentTime,
  • and all conditions defined in the job are satisfied by the filters
    filters are passed as a string array, where elements at even index are filter names, followed by their value at next index.
    If the length of filters is an odd number, the value for last filter is considered an empty string

    Parameters:
    traceID - - trace ID
    traceInterface - - the interface name is the entry point for the PAC (AVM)
    filters - - a string array
    Returns:
    isTraceEnabled

    • trace

    public static void trace(String rsCode,
                         String[] msgParams,
                         String[] tagValues)
    Log a trace message. This method will only log the trace message if trace is enabled for the context.
    The method will fetch the message and tags using the resource code rsCode.
    messageParameters are supplied to the message string and tagValues are added to the tags.

    Parameters:
    rsCode - - resource code
    msgParams - - message parameters
    tagValues - - tag values
